newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Hungary wheat futures drop on intl price fall.
newsitem.headline: Hungary wheat futures drop on intl price fall.

text.p: Hungarian wheat futures dropped by the daily limit of 400 forints on Thursday due to a fall in prices on international markets on Wednesday, traders said.
"This happened because prices substantially dropped in Chicago," said Gabor Gyori of Order Brokerage.
He added that Chicago wheat prices rose on Thursday but Hungarian wheat futures were likely to drop further on Friday, although perhaps not so much as on Thursday.
"The wheat got a strong impetus today," he said.

Both milling and feed wheat futures fell by 400 forints on the Budapest Commodity Exchange (BCE), with milling wheat futures accounting for four-fifth of the bourse's grain turnover of 335 million forints, or 704 lots.
July and August were the most actively traded maturities for milling wheat, with July closing at 23,700 forints and August at 23,980.
Maize futures remained steady and traded in a low turnover of 22 lots.
"Everybody concentrates on the wheat now," Gyori said.
